item.title: ICC Men’s Champions Trophy 2025 schedule announced - ICC Cricket
item.description:
ICC Men’s Champions Trophy 2025 Schedule Announced

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here]Source: [Insert Source Here]

The International Cricket Council (ICC) has announced the fixtures for the ICC Men’s Champions Trophy 2025, set to take place from February 19 to March 9 in Pakistan and the UAE.

  • The tournament will feature 15 matches with eight teams over 19 days.
  • Dubai International Cricket Stadium is confirmed as a neutral venue.
  • Fans can register their interest for tickets here.

The tournament marks the return of the Champions Trophy after its last edition in 2017, with Pakistan hosting the event for the first time since 1996. Group A includes Bangladesh, India, New Zealand, and Pakistan, while Group B comprises Afghanistan, Australia, England, and South Africa.

“The ICC is delighted to release the schedule for the Men’s Champions Trophy 2025... This Champions Trophy is truly poised to be an unmissable celebration of the World Cricket’s finest.” - Jay Shah, ICC Chair

This event not only highlights cricket's competitive spirit but also showcases Pakistan as a host, promising an exciting atmosphere for players and fans alike.

item.title: Vinod Kambli's brain declared 'unstable' by doctor: 'There are degenerative changes...' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Vinod Kambli's Brain Condition Causes Concern, Doctor Reports Unstable Health

Date: Dec 24, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Vinod Kambli's health has been declared concerning by his doctor, as his brain condition is reported to be unstable following a recent hospitalization.

  • Kambli admitted to Aakriti Hospital after health deterioration, experiencing high-grade fever and muscle cramps.
  • Doctor's update: expected discharge in 2-3 days, but brain condition remains unstable with degenerative changes.
  • Kambli expressed gratitude towards Sachin Tendulkar for his support amid health challenges.
“His brain's condition is not stable... There are degenerative changes in his brain. So, we are focussing more on rehabilitation.” - Dr. Vivek Dwivedi

Despite his health issues, Kambli remains positive, indicating a hopeful recovery while continuing rehabilitation efforts.

item.title: Manu Bhaker admits lapse on her part while filing Khel Ratna nominations, says 'awards are not my goal' - The Times of India
item.description:
Manu Bhaker admits lapse on her part while filing Khel Ratna nominations, says 'awards are not my goal'

Publication Date: [Date not provided] Source: [Source not provided]

Olympic shooter Manu Bhaker has acknowledged her own mistake in the nomination process for the Khel Ratna awards. She emphasized that while she values achievements, her primary focus remains on her sports career rather than awards.

  • Manu Bhaker made an admission of oversight in her Khel Ratna nominations.
  • She reiterated that awards are not her main goal in sports.
  • Bhaker remains dedicated to enhancing her performance in competitions.
“Awards are not my goal,” Manu Bhaker stated, highlighting her commitment to sports.

In conclusion, despite her acknowledgement of the mistake, Bhaker continues to prioritize her athletic pursuits over accolades.

item.title: Virat Kohli's Request For Fans During Practice Is Viral Ahead Of Boxing Day Test Against Australia - NDTV Sports
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: Boxing Day Test: Will Rohit Sharma and Usman Khawaja, Shubman Gill and Rishabh Pant, finally stand up? - The Indian Express
item.description:
Boxing Day Test: Will Rohit Sharma and Usman Khawaja, Shubman Gill and Rishabh Pant, finally stand up?

Publication Date: December 25, 2023 | Source: Indian Express

As Christmas Eve unfolds in Melbourne, anticipation builds for the Boxing Day Test, a cherished tradition in Australian cricket. With expectations of 90,000 spectators and soaring temperatures, the match signifies not only sportsmanship but the evolving narratives of cricket history in Australia.

  • The Boxing Day Test has become synonymous with cricket culture in Australia, evolving dramatically since its inception.
  • Dr. Thomas Heenan notes the influence of marketing and the need for "instant tradition" in the sport.
  • The game's popularity surged after the 1979 acquisition of TV rights by Kerry Packer, marking a pivotal shift in how cricket was consumed.
  • India's presence in the Australian cricket landscape has grown since the 1983 World Cup, intensifying the competitive spirit.
  • The pitch conditions suggest that fast bowlers will thrive, with significant sideways movement expected.
  • Both teams face challenges with their batting units, particularly under pressure from quality bowling.
“The scoreline is a fair reflection of two below-par batting units who haven’t come to terms with the moving Kookaburra newish ball.”

In conclusion, as the Boxing Day Test draws near, all eyes will be on the batsmen, particularly Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli, to perform in a pressure-laden environment and possibly redefine the legacy of their performances in this iconic match.

item.title: Jasprit Bumrah's Action Questioned, Australian Broadcaster Makes Controversy-Prone Remark - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Ian Maurice Questions Jasprit Bumrah's Bowling Action Ahead of Boxing Day Test

Date: December 24, 2024 | Source: NDTV Sports

The upcoming Boxing Day Test between India and Australia is marred by controversy as Ian Maurice questions Jasprit Bumrah's bowling action, amid other off-field incidents involving Indian players.

  • Ian Maurice accuses Bumrah of having a suspect bowling action.
  • Further criticisms were aimed at Indian players, including Virat Kohli and Ravindra Jadeja.
  • Maurice urges Australian media to scrutinize Bumrah's bowling technique.
  • Bumrah is India's leading wicket-taker in the ongoing Border-Gavaskar Trophy series.
I wish you people who want to jump down my throat would bother to read what I wrote. I said "I'M NOT SAYING HE'S THROWING ... but his action should be analyzed...that's all!" — Ian Maurice (@ian_maurice)

The controversy highlights ongoing scrutiny over bowling actions in cricket, especially in Australia.

item.title: EXCLUSIVE | With R Ashwin retired, is time running out for Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli in Tests? - The Times of India
item.description:
EXCLUSIVE | With R Ashwin retired, is time running out for Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli in Tests?

Publication Date: NEW DELHI

R Ashwin's unexpected retirement has left a void in the Indian cricket team, prompting discussions about the future of veteran players Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli in Test cricket.

  • Rohit Sharma's recent performances have raised concerns, notably scores of 3, 6, and 10 in recent Tests.
  • Virat Kohli has struggled with consistency, with only one significant score in the series.
  • Sunil Joshi believes modern demands require players to assess their longevity in the game.
  • Speculation surrounds the potential for more retirements from senior players after the series.
“Rohit and Virat know what their bodies can handle and how much they have left to give.” - Sunil Joshi

The Indian cricket team is expected to experience a transition as veterans retire, but rising talents like Washington Sundar and others are positioned to take their places.

item.title: India women vs West Indies women, 2nd ODI LIVE Score: Pratika departs for 78; IND-W 185/2 vs WI-W - Sportstar
item.description:
India women vs West Indies women, 2nd ODI LIVE Score: Harleen, Harmanpreet take IND-W towards 200; IND-W 191/2

Date Published: December 24, 2024

Source: Sportstar

The article provides live commentary, score updates, and highlights from the ongoing match between India's women team and the West Indies women's team.

  • India has scored 191 runs for the loss of 2 wickets.
  • Harleen Deol and Harmanpreet Kaur are key players in the ongoing innings.
  • The match is being held at the Vadodara International Cricket Stadium.
  • Live commentary and score updates are available through Sportstar.
'FIFTY for Pratika! First one for the opener in international cricket.'

This ODI match is crucial as India aims to secure the series win following their earlier victories.

item.title: 'That's a lie...': Vaughan says 'what Jadeja did...' with Australian media in Melbourne is because 'India a powerhouse' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Vaughan Comments on Jadeja's Press Conference with Australian Media

Date: Dec 24, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The article discusses former England captain Michael Vaughan's remarks regarding the controversy surrounding Ravindra Jadeja's press interactions with Australian media before the Boxing Day Test in Melbourne. Vaughan suggests that the situation could have been mitigated with AI tools for translation.

  • The Australian media reacted negatively when Jadeja only answered in Hindi.
  • The BCCI media stated Jadeja couldn't continue due to a pressing schedule.
  • Vaughan advised the Australian journalists to make use of AI for translations.
  • He also humorously questioned the validity of the Indian media manager's claim about catching a bus.
“India are a powerhouse... There are AI systems that you can use to translate Hindi into Australian English.” - Michael Vaughan

Vaughan's comments highlight the cultural differences and communication issues between Indian and Australian media, especially in a high-stakes series like the Boxing Day Test.

item.title: Virat Kohli vs the fifth stump: A battle of will and skill ahead of the Boxing Day Test - The Times of India
item.description:
Virat Kohli vs the Fifth Stump: A Battle of Will and Skill Ahead of the Boxing Day Test

Publication Date: Not provided | Source: Times of India

As India prepares for the Boxing Day Test, Virat Kohli is honing his skills, particularly focusing on his discipline against deliveries outside off-stump.

  • Kohli is seen practicing in the nets at the Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG).
  • Rohit Sharma expresses confidence in Kohli's ability to overcome challenges.
  • He is working on leaving balls outside the off-stump while facing quick bowlers.
  • Kohli actively engages with bowlers to understand the impact of deliveries.
  • Despite challenges, there is optimism that Kohli will find his form in the upcoming Test.
“Modern day greats will figure out their way… path,” - Rohit Sharma

The outcome of this self-battle for Kohli will be crucial for India's performance, especially with significant crowd expectations for the Boxing Day Test.

item.title: Niki Prasad to lead India in Under-19 Women's T20 World Cup 2025 - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
Niki Prasad to Lead India in Under-19 Women's T20 World Cup 2025

Publication Date: TBD Source: ESPN Cricinfo

The Under-19 Indian women's cricket team, led by Niki Prasad, is set to compete in the U-19 World Cup in Malaysia, maintaining most of the squad that won the recent Under-19 Asia Cup, with one change in the lineup.

  • Niki Prasad will captain a 15-member squad in the World Cup, with Vaishnavi S replacing Nandhana S.
  • The team recently won the Asia Cup, defeating Bangladesh by 41 runs in the final.
  • Gongadi Trisha was named Player of the Match with a score of 52.
  • India's matches in the World Cup will take place from January 19 to February 2, starting against West Indies.
  • The team is in Group A alongside Malaysia and Sri Lanka.
"India's win at the Asia Cup came after an unbeaten run, showcasing their dominance in the tournament."

The U-19 Women's T20 World Cup represents a significant opportunity for these young athletes to shine on an international stage.

item.title: "Thankful To Sachin Tendulkar...": Vinod Kambli's Big Message After Urgent Hospitalisation - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Thankful To Sachin Tendulkar...: Vinod Kambli's Big Message After Urgent Hospitalisation

Publication Date: December 24, 2024  |  Source: NDTV

Former Indian cricketer Vinod Kambli expressed his thankfulness towards Sachin Tendulkar following his hospitalization due to health complications. Kambli recently faced severe health issues along with brain clots but is now showing signs of recovery.

  • Kambli was hospitalized after a fan took him due to a health scare.
  • Medical tests indicated the presence of clots in his brain, but updates show he is recovering.
  • He acknowledged Tendulkar’s emotional support during difficult times.
  • Doctors are monitoring Kambli's health closely and have promised lifelong medical care.
“I am feeling better now...I will never leave this (cricket) because I remember the number of centuries and double centuries I have hit...I am thankful to Sachin Tendulkar as his blessings have always been with me...” - Vinod Kambli

Kambli is on a path to recovery with support from his family and friends, emphasizing the importance of community during challenging times.

item.title: 'I shouldn't have gone to the Olympics and won medals for the country': Manu Bhaker devastated by Khel Ratna axe - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Manu Bhaker Heartbroken Over Khel Ratna Exclusion

Date: Dec 24, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Manu Bhaker, the celebrated shooter and twin medal winner at the Paris Olympics, is devastated after being excluded from the Rajiv Gandhi Khel Ratna award shortlist despite her historic achievements.

  • Manu Bhaker won two bronze medals at the Paris Olympics 2024, becoming the first Indian athlete of the Independence era to achieve this feat.
  • Despite being a strong candidate, she was not shortlisted for the Khel Ratna award.
  • Bhaker's father shared her disappointment, stating she felt she shouldn't have participated in the Olympics at all.
  • The sports ministry's decision has drawn backlash from fans and may prompt reconsideration.
  • She has a remarkable record of 17 gold, six silver, and five bronze medals in various shooting events since the Tokyo Games.
“I shouldn't have gone to the Olympics and won medals for the country. In fact, I shouldn't have become a sportsperson.” - Manu Bhaker

This exclusion has sparked significant discussion among sports fans and officials, potentially influencing future deliberations on recognition for athletes.

item.description:
Manu Bhaker Khel Ratna row: Why exception was made for Mohammed Shami last year

In this article, the controversy surrounding the Khel Ratna award exemptions for athletes like Mohammed Shami is discussed, highlighting the discrepancies in eligibility and recognition.

Quote or statistic related to the impact of these decisions on athletes.

item.title: 'Shubman Gill ko bula do': Rohit Sharma annoyed at female fan's repeated request during India's MCG net session – Watch - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Rohit Sharma Annoyed by Fan's Request for Shubman Gill During MCG Net Session

Date: Dec 24, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

During India's training session at the MCG, Rohit Sharma faced an awkward moment when a female fan repeatedly requested him to call Shubman Gill, who had already left the nets.

  • India's first training session at MCG amidst the Border-Gavaskar Trophy series.
  • Rohit Sharma was approached by a female fan asking for Shubman Gill after the session.
  • Rohit expressed annoyance when the fan persisted with her request.
  • The fan revealed she was late due to a fractured leg and expressed support for Gill.
“Where will I get him?” - Rohit Sharma's response to the persistent fan.

The incident highlights the challenges faced by players during public interactions, especially in high-pressure environments.

item.title: Rohit Sharma breaks silence on Virat Kohli's outside off-stump woes: ‘You only said he’s a modern-day great' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Rohit Sharma Discusses Virat Kohli's Struggles With Outside Off-Stump Deliveries

Date: Dec 24, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

Rohit Sharma has addressed the media regarding Virat Kohli's recent difficulties with deliveries outside the off-stump during the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, expressing confidence that Kohli will find a way to score runs in the upcoming Tests.

  • Rohit laughed when asked about Kohli's form, emphasizing Kohli's status as a modern-day great.
  • Kohli has had a challenging series, with only one century to his name so far.
  • Multiple bowlers, including Boland and Hazlewood, have troubled Kohli with their bowling style.
  • Rohit himself is also struggling, particularly with in-swing deliveries.
  • The upcoming Boxing Day Test is crucial for India's batting lineup as the series is tied 1-1.
“You only said he is a modern-day great. Modern-day greats will figure out their way or the path (to overcome issues),” - Rohit Sharma

Sharma remains confident that both he and Kohli will rectify their issues as they prepare for the important matches ahead.

item.title: Tanush Kotian to join India's Test squad as Ashwin's replacement - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
Tanush Kotian to Join India's Test Squad as Ashwin's Replacement

Publication Date: [Insert date here] | Source: ESPN Cricinfo

Tanush Kotian, a crucial player for Mumbai, has been selected to replace R Ashwin in the Indian squad for the upcoming Border-Gavaskar Trophy Tests due to Ashwin's retirement.

  • Kotian is traveling to Melbourne following Ashwin's retirement after the third Test.
  • He is seen as a backup for spinners Washington Sundar and Ravindra Jadeja, with Axar Patel unavailable.
  • Rohit Sharma commented on Kotian's call-up, highlighting his domestic achievements.
  • Kotian's impressive Ranji Trophy performance last season contributed to Mumbai's victory, leading to him being named Player-of-the-Tournament.
  • He has played 33 first-class matches, recorded 101 wickets, and scored 1525 runs.
"Tanush was the right option for us at this point. He's certainly shown in the domestic level what he's capable of. He's probably one of the reasons why Mumbai has gone on to win the Ranji Trophy last year." Rohit Sharma

With many players unavailable, Kotian's inclusion marks a significant opportunity for the young allrounder in international cricket.

item.title: Suryakumar, Shreyas Iyer, Shivam Dube at No 8, 9 and 10? Mumbai's ploy goes awry; saved by Ashwin's India replacement - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Mumbai's Unconventional Batting Order Pays Off With Iyer and Kotian's Heroics

Published on: Dec 24, 2024 by: HT Sports Desk

Mumbai's cricket team faced a tough challenge during their chase against Hyderabad in the Vijay Hazare Trophy, but a remarkable effort from Shreyas Iyer and Tanush Kotian turned the tide for them, securing a three-wicket victory.

  • Mumbai attempted a risky strategy by reversing their batting order.
  • They struggled initially, losing six wickets for just 67 runs.
  • Suryakumar Yadav entered at No. 8 and helped stabilize the innings.
  • Iyer contributed significantly with a quick score of 44 runs off 20 balls.
  • Mumbai chased down the target of 170, finishing at 175 runs for 7 wickets.
"The plan failed initially, but teamwork saved the day for Mumbai."

This match showcased the unpredictability of cricket and how unconventional strategies can lead to unexpected victories.

item.title: On Doubts Over Travis Head's Participation In Boxing Day Test, Australia Coach Paints Clear Picture - NDTV Sports
item.description:
On Doubts Over Travis Head's Participation In Boxing Day Test, Australia Coach Paints Clear Picture

Date: December 24, 2024 Source: NDTV

Ahead of the fourth Test against India, Australia coach Andrew McDonald reassures that Travis Head is fit to play after a minor quad strain.

  • Travis Head suffered a minor quad strain during the Brisbane Test but had a short running and fielding session on Tuesday.
  • He is the leading run-scorer in the series with 409 runs at an average of 81.80.
  • Coach McDonald reported no major fitness concerns regarding Head's participation.
  • McDonald expressed confidence, stating Head has completed running drills and appears ready for the match.
  • In his career against India, Head averages 51.09 in Tests and has scored 897 runs at an average of 74.75 since the WTC final.
  • Australia and India are level at 1-1 in the series with two matches remaining.
“There is no concern at the moment. Has he been officially ticked off? I am not sure... But no concerns from my end.” - Andrew McDonald

The reassurance from the coach bodes well for Australia's chances as they prepare for a crucial encounter at the MCG.

item.title: India reveal squad for the upcoming U19 Women’s T20 World Cup - ICC Cricket
item.description:
India Reveal Squad for the Upcoming U19 Women’s T20 World Cup

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

India has announced its squad for the U19 Women’s T20 World Cup, featuring 16 teams divided into four groups.

  • Squad: Niki Prasad (Captain), Sanika Chalke (Vice-captain), G Trisha, Kamalini G (WK), Bhavika Ahire (WK), Ishwari Awasare, Mithila Vinod, Joshitha VJ, Sonam Yadav, Parunika Sisodiya, Kesari Drithi, Aayushi Shukla, Anandita Kishor, MD Shabnam, Vaishnavi S
  • Standby Players: Nandhana S, Ira J, Anadi T
  • India is placed in Group A along with Malaysia, Sri Lanka, and West Indies.
  • Group stage matches will be hosted at Bayuemas Oval in Kuala Lumpur.
  • India's campaign begins on January 19 against West Indies.

item.title: 'I don't blow kisses to my better half sitting in dressing room or hospitality box': Ravichandran Ashwin debunks myths - Hindustan Times
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: Why Did India Choose Tanush Kotian Over Kuldeep Yadav & Axar Patel? Skipper Rohit Sharma Explains - News18
item.description:
Rohit Sharma Explains Selection of Tanush Kotian for the Test Squad

Date: December 24, 2024 Source: News

Indian skipper Rohit Sharma shared insights into the squad selection for the 2024-25 Border-Gavaskar Trophy, highlighting the inclusion of Tanush Kotian over Kuldeep Yadav and Axar Patel.

  • Kuldeep Yadav's recovery from hernia surgery and Axar Patel's recent fatherhood opened opportunities for Kotian.
  • Kotian was a standout player in the 2024-25 Ranji Trophy, with impressive stats of 502 runs and 29 wickets in 10 matches.
  • Sharma mentioned the need for a backup spinner due to injuries and recoveries in the team.
“Tanush was here a month back... Not that Tanush is not good enough. He has shown in the last two years what he has done in domestic cricket and we really wanted just a backup.” - Rohit Sharma

Rohit emphasized the importance of Kotian's recent form and readiness, stating that he is a valuable option for the team.

item.title: 'Modern-day great Virat Kohli will figure it out' - Rohit Sharma - The Times of India
item.description:
'Modern-day great Virat Kohli will figure it out' - Rohit Sharma

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

As India and Australia prepare for the fourth Test of the Border Gavaskar Trophy, Kohli's inconsistent performance is under scrutiny. Captain Rohit Sharma expresses confidence in Kohli, stating he believes Kohli will regain his form.

  • Kohli has scored 126 runs in five Test innings during the series, with an average of 31.50.
  • Rohit Sharma, despite his own struggles, remains optimistic about Kohli’s ability to turn things around.
  • Rohit commented on modern-day greats like Kohli saying they will find their own path to success.
  • The team dynamics have shifted, with Rohit batting in the middle order, affecting his performance.
  • Rohit has insisted on keeping the team's batting order strategy private.
"Modern-day greats will figure out their own way of (carving out their) path." - Rohit Sharma

In summary, while Kohli's form has been a concern, Rohit Sharma's confidence in his ability to bounce back is a reassuring message for fans as India looks to make a mark in the ongoing series against Australia.

item.title: 'Kuldeep Yadav doesn't have visa and Axar...': Rohit Sharma reveals why Tanush Kotian was picked as Ashwin's replacement - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Rohit Sharma explains why Tanush Kotian was picked as Ashwin's replacement ahead of Kuldeep Yadav and Axar Patel

Date: Dec 24, 2024 10:23 AM IST Source: HT Sports

India’s cricket team captain Rohit Sharma explained the decision to select Tanush Kotian as a replacement for the retired Ravichandran Ashwin in the upcoming Border-Gavaskar Trophy Tests.

  • Tanush Kotian was chosen as Ashwin's replacement after Ashwin's retirement from international cricket.
  • Rohit humorously noted that Kuldeep Yadav was not selected due to visa issues.
  • Kotian recently performed well in the ‘A’ tour in Australia.
  • Kuldeep Yadav is recovering from hernia surgery, and Axar Patel recently became a father, making him unavailable.
  • Kotian has a strong track record in first-class cricket, with 101 wickets and 1525 runs.
“Tanush was here a month back and Kuldeep doesn't have a visa... we wanted a back-up in case we play two spinners in Sydney or Melbourne.” - Rohit Sharma

The selection highlights the team's strategy to ensure readiness with injuries and personal matters affecting player availability.
